page.title: 01NORTH-EAST SPALDING
page.content:
The twelve squares assigned to us for the survey lie to the North-East of the market town of Spalding.
The land is used largely for agricultural purposes. The land is intesively farmed being that it is very fertile land.
Lieing along the Southern part of the block is the Industrial Area of Spalding. The now established food processing companies such as Smedley's and British Sugar were built here over 50 years ago. New small factories have been encouraged into the area.
There is limited residential property in the area most of it lieing along the A16 which runs through the block.
